result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony John Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.
Contact with J. M. M. as permitted by the agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall participate in and cooperate with Anger Management treatment and comply with recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony John Martin

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tony John Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Tony John Martin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Not guilty plea entered by Court.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Atty. de Junco requests a signature bond.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond.  Defendant cannot provide friends address.  Court concerned and considering cash bond.  Court changes bond to $250.00 cash bond.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Court appoints Atty David Nelson.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate to be determined.
